tools.name: listCustomers
tools.description: Retrieve a paginated list of customers, with options for searching, filtering by ID, external ID, email, phone number, communication status, auto-charge status, creation date, customer name, and business entity ID.

args.name: cursor
args.description: The cursor for pagination to fetch the next or previous set of records.

args.name: limit
args.description: Maximum number of customers to return per page (defaults to 10).

args.name: search
args.description: General search query (e.g., 'name=john,custom_data.key=john@zenskar.com').

args.name: order
args.description: Order of results (e.g., '-created_at' for descending creation date).

args.name: sortKey
args.description: Key to sort the results by (e.g., 'id').

args.name: sortType
args.description: Sort order type (e.g., 'asc' for ascending).

args.name: expand
args.description: Fields to expand in the response (e.g., 'contacts').

args.name: id
args.description: Filter by customer ID (exact match).

args.name: id__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for customer ID.

args.name: id__in
args.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of customer IDs.

args.name: external_id
args.description: Filter by external ID (exact match).

args.name: external_id__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for external ID.

args.name: email
args.description: Filter by email (exact match).

args.name: email__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for email.

args.name: phoneNumber__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for phone number.

args.name: communications_enabled
args.description: Filter by communications enabled status.

args.name: auto_charge_enabled
args.description: Filter by auto-charge enabled status.

args.name: created_at__gte
args.description: Filter by creation date greater than or equal to (ISO 8601 format).

args.name: created_at__lte
args.description: Filter by creation date less than or equal to (ISO 8601 format).

args.name: customer_name__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for customer name.

args.name: business_entity_id
args.description: Filter by business entity ID (exact match).

args.name: invoice__customer_id
args.description: Filter by invoice customer ID.

args.name: invoice__status
args.description: Filter by invoice status.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Customer List

Here is the list of customers based on your criteria:

tools.name: getCustomerById
tools.description: Retrieve details for a specific customer by their ID.

args.name: customerId
args.description: The unique ID of the customer to retrieve.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Customer Details

Here are the details for the requested customer:

tools.name: listContacts
tools.description: Retrieve a paginated list of contacts.

args.name: cursor
args.description: The cursor for pagination.

args.name: limit
args.description: Maximum number of contacts to return per page (defaults to 10).

args.name: sortKey
args.description: Key to sort the results by (e.g., 'id').

args.name: sortType
args.description: Sort order type (e.g., 'asc').

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Contact List

Here is the list of contacts:

tools.name: getContactById
tools.description: Retrieve details for a specific contact by their ID.

args.name: contactId
args.description: The unique ID of the contact to retrieve.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Contact Details

Here are the details for the requested contact:

tools.name: listInvoices
tools.description: Retrieve a paginated list of invoices, with options for filtering by customer, status, amounts, due date, creation date, and related customer/contract details.

args.name: customerId
args.description: Filter invoices by a specific customer ID.

args.name: customerExternalId
args.description: Filter invoices by a customer's external ID.

args.name: status
args.description: Filter invoices by their status (e.g., 'draft', 'approved', 'paid', 'void', 'partially_paid', 'upcoming').

args.name: status__in
args.description: Filter invoices by multiple statuses (comma-separated, e.g., 'draft,approved,paid,partially_paid,upcoming,void').

args.name: cursor
args.description: The cursor for pagination.

args.name: limit
args.description: Maximum number of invoices to return per page (defaults to 10).

args.name: contractId
args.description: Filter by contract ID.

args.name: externalId
args.description: Filter by invoice external ID.

args.name: invoiceTotal__gte
args.description: Filter by invoice total greater than or equal to.

args.name: invoiceTotal__lte
args.description: Filter by invoice total less than or equal to.

args.name: amountDue__gte
args.description: Filter by amount due greater than or equal to.

args.name: amountDue__lte
args.description: Filter by amount due less than or equal to.

args.name: dueDate__gte
args.description: Filter by due date greater than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: dueDate__lte
args.description: Filter by due date less than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: createdAt__gte
args.description: Filter by creation date greater than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: createdAt__lte
args.description: Filter by creation date less than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: invoice_number__like
args.description: Partial match for invoice number.

args.name: customer__customer_name__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for customer name associated with the invoice.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Invoice List

Here are the invoices matching your criteria:

args.name: cursor

args.name: limit
args.description: Maximum number of records to return per page (defaults to 10).

args.name: order

args.name: sortKey
args.description: Key to sort the results by (e.g., 'id').

args.name: sortType
args.description: Sort order type (e.g., 'asc').

args.name: id
args.description: Filter by aggregate ID.

args.name: name__ilike

tools.name: listRawMetrics
tools.description: Get usage events in paginated form, with options for filtering by ID, name, and API slug.

args.name: cursor
args.description: The cursor for pagination.

args.name: limit
args.description: Maximum number of records to return per page (defaults to 10).

args.name: order
args.description: Order of results (e.g., '-created_at').

args.name: sortKey
args.description: Key to sort the results by (e.g., 'created_at').

args.name: sortType
args.description: Sort order type (e.g., 'asc').

args.name: search
args.description: General search query.

args.name: id
args.description: Filter by usage event ID.

args.name: name__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for usage event name.

args.name: api_slug__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for API slug.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Usage Events List

Here is the list of usage events:

tools.name: createRawMetric
tools.description: Create a new raw metric (usage event schema) with column definitions and connectors.

approvalConfig.title: Create Raw Metric
approvalConfig.description: This will create a new raw metric and provision its event schema. Please review the payload carefully.
approvalConfig.warningText: Ensure the dataschema and slug values are correct before continuing.

args.name: name
args.description: Human-friendly name for the raw metric.

args.name: api_slug
args.description: API slug used when ingesting events (lowercase, underscores).

args.name: connector
args.description: Connector that owns this raw metric (e.g., push_to_zenskar).

args.name: api_type
args.description: API type for ingestion (typically PUSH).

args.name: dataschema
args.description: Data schema of raw metric (JSON object). Structure: {"data": {custom_fields}, "timestamp": "DateTime64", "customer_id": "String"}. The 'data' map must include only valid ClickHouse types (String, Int64, Float64, Date32, DateTime64, UUID, Bool); use 'Bool' instead of 'Boolean'.

args.name: column_order
args.description: Optional ordered list of columns for downstream processing. Locked to ['timestamp'] in production; leave as-is unless backend explicitly requests a schema change.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Raw Metric Created

The raw metric was created successfully:

tools.name: listAllPayments
tools.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all payments, with extensive filtering and sorting options.

args.name: cursor
args.description: The cursor for pagination.

args.name: limit
args.description: Maximum number of payments to return per page (defaults to 10).

args.name: search
args.description: General search query.

args.name: sortKey
args.description: Key to sort the results by (e.g., 'id').

args.name: sortType
args.description: Sort order type (e.g., 'asc').

args.name: order
args.description: Order of results (e.g., '-created_at').

args.name: id
args.description: Filter by payment ID.

args.name: customerId
args.description: Filter by customer ID.

args.name: connectorId
args.description: Filter by connector ID.

args.name: externalId__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for external ID.

args.name: paymentMethod
args.description: Filter by payment method (e.g., 'card', 'cash', 'bank_transfer').

args.name: type
args.description: Filter by payment type (e.g., 'payment', 'refund').

args.name: amount__gte
args.description: Filter by amount greater than or equal to.

args.name: amount__lte
args.description: Filter by amount less than or equal to.

args.name: amount_refunded__gte
args.description: Filter by amount refunded greater than or equal to.

args.name: amount_refunded__lte
args.description: Filter by amount refunded less than or equal to.

args.name: currencyCode__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for currency code.

args.name: receiptNumber__ilike
args.description: Case-insensitive partial match for receipt number.

args.name: status
args.description: Filter by payment status (e.g., 'success', 'failed').

args.name: autocharge
args.description: Filter by auto-charge status.

args.name: parentId
args.description: Filter by parent payment ID.

args.name: timestamp__gte
args.description: Filter by timestamp greater than or equal to (Unix time).

args.name: timestamp__lte
args.description: Filter by timestamp less than or equal to (Unix time).

args.name: createdAt__gte
args.description: Filter by creation date greater than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: createdAt__lte
args.description: Filter by creation date less than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: invoice__id
args.description: Filter by associated invoice ID.

args.name: invoice__bill_for_date__gte
args.description: Filter by invoice billing date greater than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: invoice__bill_for_date__lte
args.description: Filter by invoice billing date less than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: invoice__approved_at__gte
args.description: Filter by invoice approval date greater than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: invoice__approved_at__lte
args.description: Filter by invoice approval date less than or equal to (ISO 8601).

args.name: customer__business_entity_id
args.description: Filter by customer's business entity ID.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## All Payments List

tools.name: createContractPrompt
tools.description: Create a new contract prompt and save it to the system.

approvalConfig.title: Create Contract Prompt
approvalConfig.description: This will create a new AI contract prompt. Please verify the prompt content.
approvalConfig.warningText: This will save a new contract prompt that may be used for AI-generated content.

args.name: prompt_name
args.description: A name for the prompt (required by API).

args.name: prompt_text
args.description: The prompt text to save.

args.name: document_id
args.description: The ID of the contract document this prompt is for.

args.name: prompt_schema
args.description: Optional schema for the prompt (e.g., 'billing_schema'). Can be null.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Contract Prompt Created

Prompt has been saved successfully:

tools.name: listContracts
tools.description: Retrieve a paginated list of contracts, with extensive options for filtering by ID, customer ID, name, start date, end date, creation date, and status.

args.name: cursor
args.description: The cursor for pagination to fetch the next or previous set of records.

args.name: limit
args.description: Maximum number of records to return per page (defaults to 10).

args.name: order
args.description: Order of results (e.g., '-created_at' for descending creation date).

args.name: id
args.description: Filter by Contract ID (exact match).

args.name: id__ilike
args.description: Contract ID (case-insensitive partial match).

args.name: id__like
args.description: Contract ID (case-sensitive partial match).

args.name: id__in
args.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of Contract IDs.

args.name: id__isnull
args.description: Filter by whether Contract ID is null.

args.name: customer_id
args.description: Filter by Customer ID (exact match).

args.name: customer_id__in
args.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of Customer IDs.

args.name: customer_id__isnull
args.description: Filter by whether Customer ID is null.

args.name: name
args.description: Filter by Contract Name (exact match).

args.name: name__ilike
args.description: Contract Name (case-insensitive partial match).

args.name: name__like
args.description: Contract Name (case-sensitive partial match).

args.name: name__in
args.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of Contract Names.

args.name: name__isnull
args.description: Filter by whether Contract Name is null.

args.name: start_date
args.description: Contract Start Date (exact match, ISO 8601).

args.name: start_date__neq
args.description: Contract Start Date (not equal, ISO 8601).

args.name: start_date__gt
args.description: Contract Start Date (greater than, ISO 8601).

args.name: start_date__gte
args.description: Contract Start Date (greater than or equal to, ISO 8601).

args.name: start_date__lt
args.description: Contract Start Date (less than, ISO 8601).

args.description: Contract Start Date (less than or equal to, ISO 8601).

args.name: start_date__isnull
args.description: Filter by whether Contract Start Date is null.

args.name: start_date__in
args.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of Contract Start Dates.

args.name: created_at
args.description: Contract Created At (exact match, ISO 8601).

args.name: created_at__neq
args.description: Contract Created At (not equal, ISO 8601).

args.name: created_at__gt
args.description: Contract Created At (greater than, ISO 8601).

args.name: created_at__gte
args.description: Contract Created At (greater than or equal to, ISO 8601).

args.name: created_at__lt
args.description: Contract Created At (less than, ISO 8601).

args.name: created_at__lte
args.description: Contract Created At (less than or equal to, ISO 8601).

args.name: created_at__isnull
args.description: Filter by whether Contract Created At is null.

args.name: created_at__in
args.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of Contract Creation Dates.

args.name: end_date

args.name: end_date__neq
args.description: Contract End Date (not equal, ISO 8601).

args.name: end_date__gt

args.name: end_date__isnull

args.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of contract statuses.

## Contract List

tools.name: createEntitlement
tools.description: Creates a new entitlement in the system with various attributes including name, description, type, units, and product association.

approvalConfig.title: Create New Entitlement
approvalConfig.description: This will create a new entitlement in your system. Please review the details carefully.
approvalConfig.warningText: This action will create a new entitlement record that may affect billing and access control.

args.name: name
args.description: Entitlement name (required).

args.name: description
args.description: Entitlement description (optional).

args.name: entitlement_type
args.description: Type of entitlement (e.g., 'Quantity', 'Feature', 'Access').

args.name: units
args.description: Units for the entitlement (e.g., 'units', 'GB', 'users').

args.name: is_active
args.description: Whether the entitlement is active (defaults to true).

args.name: product_id
args.description: Associated product ID (UUID format, optional).

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Entitlement Created

New entitlement has been successfully created:

tools.name: approveInvoice
tools.description: Approves an invoice. This changes the invoice status to approved and may trigger billing processes.

approvalConfig.title: Approve Invoice
approvalConfig.description: This will approve the specified invoice without sending email notification. Please review the invoice details carefully.
approvalConfig.warningText: This action will approve the invoice and may trigger billing processes. This cannot be easily undone.

args.name: invoiceId
args.description: The unique ID of the invoice to approve (required).

args.name: send_email
args.description: Whether to send email notification (defaults to false).

args.name: check_duplicate_invoice
args.description: Whether to check for duplicate invoices (defaults to true).

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Invoice Approved

The invoice has been successfully approved:

tools.name: recogniseRevenue
tools.description: Recognizes revenue for the organization up to a specified end date. This triggers revenue recognition processing for all eligible transactions.

approvalConfig.title: Recognise Revenue
approvalConfig.description: This will trigger revenue recognition processing up to the specified end date. Please review the date carefully.
approvalConfig.warningText: This action will process revenue recognition which may affect financial reporting and accounting records.

args.name: end_date
args.description: End date for revenue recognition in YYYY-MM-DD format (required).

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Revenue Recognition

Revenue recognition has been processed successfully:

tools.name: createBusinessEntity

args.description: Address zip code (optional).

args.name: address_country
args.description: Address country (optional).

args.name: address_country_code
args.description: Address country code (optional).

args.name: communications_enabled
args.description: Enable/disable communications (defaults to true).

args.name: auto_charge_enabled
args.description: Enable/disable auto-charge (defaults to true).

args.name: business_entity_id
args.description: Business entity ID (UUID format, optional).

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Customer Created

New customer has been successfully created:

tools.name: ingestRawMetricEvent
tools.description: Ingest a usage event for the specified raw metric slug.

approvalConfig.title: Ingest Usage Event
approvalConfig.description: This will ingest a usage event for the selected raw metric. Review the payload carefully.
approvalConfig.warningText: Ensure the data payload matches the raw metric schema before proceeding.

args.name: rawMetricSlug
args.description: Slug of the raw metric (e.g., api_usage_events).

args.name: event
args.description: Usage event payload containing customer_id, timestamp, and data map with schema-compliant types. Before constructing the event, fetch the schema via getRawMetricBySlug (or reuse the response from createRawMetric) so you only include fields that exist in the raw metric. Use the provided type buckets such as String/Int64 or the exact column names returned by sample logs; do not invent new keys.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Usage Event Ingested

The usage event was ingested successfully:

tools.name: extractContractFromRaw
tools.description: Extract structured contract data from raw text content using AI. This tool analyzes natural language contract descriptions and extracts key fields like dates, products, pricing, and billing terms. The extracted data can then be used to create a customer and contract via createCustomer and createContract tools.

args.name: content
args.description: The raw text content describing the contract (e.g., 'Contract starts on 1st Jan 2025 and ends on 31 Dec 2025 with a single product called chat subscription, cost is $10 per month prepaid.').

args.name: name
args.description: A name for the contract being extracted.

args.name: organization_id
args.description: The organization ID for the contract extraction (will be auto-populated from user context if not provided).

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Contract Extraction Result

The AI has extracted the following contract data from your raw text. You can use this to create a customer (if missing_fields includes customer info) and then create the contract:

tools.name: createContract
tools.description: Create a new contract in Zenskar. Use this after extracting contract data via extractContractFromRaw and creating a customer via createCustomer. The contract includes customer details, pricing phases, products, and billing configuration.

approvalConfig.title: Create New Contract
approvalConfig.description: This will create a new contract in your system. Please review the contract details carefully including customer, dates, pricing, and billing terms.
approvalConfig.warningText: This action will create a new contract record that may trigger billing processes.

args.name: name
args.description: Contract name (required).

args.name: description
args.description: Contract description (optional).

args.name: status
args.description: Contract status (defaults to 'draft').

args.name: currency
args.description: Currency code for the contract (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR').

args.name: start_date
args.description: Contract start date in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-01-01T00:00:00.000000').

args.name: end_date
args.description: Contract end date in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-12-31T23:59:59.999999').

args.name: anchor_date
args.description: Anchor date for billing cycles in ISO 8601 format (defaults to start_date).

args.name: customer_id
args.description: The ID of the customer for this contract (required, UUID format).

args.name: renewal_policy
args.description: Contract renewal policy (defaults to 'do_not_renew').

args.name: bill_parent_customer
args.description: Whether to bill the parent customer (defaults to false).

args.name: phases
args.description: Array of contract phases with pricing details. Each phase includes name, start_date, end_date, phase_type, and pricings array.

args.name: source
args.description: Source information for the contract (e.g., {source_type: 'ai', source_id: 'uuid'}).

args.name: custom_attributes
args.description: Custom attributes for the contract as key-value pairs.

responseTemplate.prependBody:
## Contract Created

New contract has been successfully created:
